intro: Achillea aurea, commonly known as golden yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic when crushed. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and dry grasslands. Its historical use in medicine and as a garden ornamental highlights its cultural and ecological significance.
